data.title: Inconsistent naming for editor groups/tabs
data.body:
re #25328

Below names are slightly confusing and don't follow the naming pattern used elsewhere. Either start with tabs or editor groups but not with an adjective. 

```
// Workbench: Tabs
	"tabsContainerBackground": "",
	"tabBorder": "",
	"activeTabBackground": "",
	"inactiveTabBackground": "",
	"activeTabActiveGroupForeground": "",
	"activeTabInactiveGroupForeground": "",
	"inactiveTabActiveGroupForeground": "",
	"inactiveTabInactiveGroupForeground": "",
```

data.title: Terminal: link detection fails for UNC paths
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/25331

Have a UNC path such as `\\localhost\c$\GitDevelopment\standup\server\db.js`. Notice that link detection for these does not work.

data.title: Terminal: link detection fails for paths with spaces inside
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/25331

Having links for folders with spaces does not seem to cause link detection to work.

data.title: extra space is added after every line of the selection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2   ( commit: 6eaebe3b ) 
- OS Version: Windows 10 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a new Visual Studio Code editor
2.  press 'a' and enter
3.  press 'b' and enter
3.  press 'c' and enter
4.  select all the lines
-> you will see there is an extra space added after every line of the selection
5. apply 'Join Lines' command
-> the lines are joined, but there is an extra space in the text after every line: 'a b c'
![vscode-bug-selection](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1622867/25431964/ffcb1ee4-2a82-11e7-80f2-d5ef549e9753.gif)

data.title: Search: using ripgrep ignores any external file that I have open
data.body:
This is a regression from compared to not using rip grep: any file that is opened is considered when searching even if the file is not loaded. To reproduce:
* open a out of workspace file
* click on another file inside the workspace
* reload window
* search for a term that is inside the out of workspace file

=> ripgrep will not find it, but the classic search does

data.title: Can navigate status bar using tab key

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: master
- OS Version: Windows

I found no way to navigate the items in the status bar using tab also most of these items act as actions as well. Users can always use F1 to run the command however we should allow navigating the status bar as well using tab.

data.title: explorer.autoReveal setting is ignored
data.body:
1. Set `"explorer.autoReveal": false`
2. I would expect that clicking on files in the explorer does not open and reveal them
3. They are still opened so the seeting seems to have no effect for me

data.title: Editor should provide shortcut to defocus editor to help navigate controls using tab

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: latest
- OS Version: Windows

Currently I need to use Ctrl+M however this is a toggle. What I would prefer is something like Escape to defocus the editor and focus the editor tool bar.

data.title: Electron keeps main menus underlined if Windows are switched using Alt+Tab

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Refs: #25326

OS: Windows

Steps:

- VS Code in focus
- press and hold Alt (observe: main menu mnemonics get underlined)
- press tab and switch to other application. Observe: VS Code main menu still underlined
- press Alt+tab again to focus back on VS Code. Observe: main menu still underlined.

data.title: Generate tree/list colors based on a single color
data.body:
Refs #25328


It is quite complex to theme the explorer tree due to the following reasons
1. The name of the settings always starts with `list` and are hardly discoverable
2. There are 6 settings with very similar names and figuring out which one does what is a mayor pain
3. Some of the settings seem to be overlaping

This case is a clear example of how an automatic color picker would be helpful. I would just define the base color for my tree selection and then all the other would just be lighter / darker variantes of the base color.

The current way I have to understand what each of the settigns does and make sure I did not miss any case and there are a lot of those when customizing the tree.

data.title: Intellisese for tsconfig.json module is incorrect
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

With `"module": "ES6",` in my tsconfig.json I get a green squiggle and tooltop says ES6 is not an accepted value.

According to https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/compiler-options.html it is

If you change ES6 to es6 the error disappears?

Note that target accepts both cases.

data.title: error navigation widget should default to editor error color

data.title: Cursor left & right can't be used to navigate main menu bar

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

OS: Windows

Refs: #25326

Not sure if Electron update related. Steps:

- press Alt+F to focus main menu bar
- press Cursor right. 

Expected: Edit menu become visible. 
Actual: File menu stays visible

In other Windows applications pressing Alt alone focuses the menu bar. This is not happening with Electron apps. Looks like a general Electron problem.

data.title: @ts-check and @ts-nocheck should be suggested by intelli-sense
data.body:
Ref: #25322

1. Open a js file and on the first line start the comment `//`
2. Invoke intelli-sense - I would expect `@ts-check` and `@ts-nocheck` to be proposed

These features are currently not discovarable enough and good suggestions would help with that.

data.title: `javascript.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs` requires a vscode restart
data.body:
Refs: #25322

The setting `javascript.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs` requires vscode to be restarted. All our other settings are applied as they are changed and I find it lame that this requires a vscode restart.
Also it is not specified anywhere that this setting requires a vscode restart so I as a user would be puzzled why VSCode is not picking up my settings change.

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:
re #25328 

It's weird that I can customise the suggest background color but not the foreground color.

![screen shot 2017-04-26 at 12 04 19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/25429231/9c95b1fe-2a78-11e7-9349-a15a6a2ba168.png)

data.title: How is javascript.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs different than javascript.validate.true
data.body:
Refs: #25322

For me it is not quite clear how is `javascript.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs` different than `javascript.validate.true`. We should either consolidate this settings if possible or make it clearer in the setting descritption what is the actual difference

data.title: javascript.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs too complex title
data.body:
Refs: #25322

1. The setting `javascript.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs` sounds too complex imho
2. Why do we have the `implicitProjectConfig` as part of the setting name

I propose `javascript.checkJs.enable`, this name is consistent with
`javascript.format.enable` and `javascript.validate.enable`

data.title: Git doesn't update when init repo from within VSCode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (48ae6e3027be560d45dd1ebfbe090d6ff77af7f0, 2017-04-26T06:13:08.212Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|gitignore|codezombiech|0.5.0|
|bracket-pair-colorizer|CoenraadS|0.10.2|
|tslint|eg2|0.12.0|

data.title: Drop cursor missing if drop location === current cursor location
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Refs: #25338

IMO the current cursor location is less important that the drop indication. So the cursor should show the drop location style.

![cast](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/25428184/5e0f94d4-2a75-11e7-9d52-fdbd3a533e72.gif)

data.title: Window in fullscreen does not restore to correct monitor in some cases
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Currently VSCode will open in fullscreen on my default monitor instead of a monitor where I left it off (closed it).

So I have to drag/move it to my external monitor (VSCode in fullscreen mode).

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

Insiders build actually acted same as usual build.

If to follow this scenario:
* Open VSCode in window mode on default screen
* Move VSCode to another screen
* Enter fullscreen mode in VSCode
* Close VSCode
* Open VSCode
* VSCode will open on remembered/last screen

that is expected, I think.

Another scenario:
* Open VSCode in window mode on *one* screen
* Enter fullscreen mode
* Move VSCode to screen *two*
* Close VSCode
* Open VSCode
* VSCode will be opened on screen *one* instead of screen *two*

to simplify: _VSCode will save position if it's in window mode_

I hope that makes sense.

----
I've tried similar scenarios with default macOS apps, say Notes.  And it's position/state have been saving either it's in window or fullscreen mode.

data.title: Illogical names for activity badges
data.body:
re #25328

Since `"activityBadge[Background|Foreground]"` only applies to the activity bar it should be prefixed with `activityBar`
